page.title: 02EDUCATION- WORMBRIDGE SCHOOL
page.content: {Wormbridge School}is a very old building. At present 86 children attend the school. We do not know how old it is, but we do know that it was the kitchen of a manor house which stood where the school playground is now. The manor house was knocked down about 1700 and you can see the shapes of some of its windows in the playground wall. We believe that the school building is older than the manor house, as it has oak beams in the roof, and the floorboards are very wide. The walls of the school are made of{bricks baked locally at Crizeley, but part of the wall at the back of the school is made of stone. Underneath the school are cellars. We use these to store furniture we no longer use. Also behind the school is the{fish pond}of the old manor house.
